techmeme.title: Sources: Oracle is on the hook for tens of billions to build unprecedentedly large data centers, including $1B per year on a gas-powered megasite in West Texas (Brody Ford/Bloomberg)
Sources: Elon Musk is quietly pumping the brakes on his plans to start a US political party, telling allies he wants to focus his attention on his companies (Brian Schwartz/Wall Street Journal)
YouGov: 59% of US adults use smart assistants to check the weather, 51% for music, 47% to get answers on the web, and 40% for timers, mirroring usage in 2018 (Rani Molla/Sherwood News)
Baidu reports Q2 revenue down 4% YoY to ~$4.6B, slightly below est., and online ad revenue down 15% YoY to ~$2.3B, as China's ad market remains weak (Deborah Sophia/Reuters)
Kick says it is "urgently reviewing" the circumstances of the death of a French livestreamer who was subjected to violence and sleep deprivation during streams (Tom McArthur/BBC)
